solution_line_template: If Jemma sold {jemma_frames_sold} glasses frames at ${jemma_price_per_frame} each, she made {jemma_frames_sold}*${jemma_price_per_frame} = $<<{jemma_frames_sold}*{jemma_price_per_frame}={jemma_total}>>{jemma_total}
Jemma sold twice as many frames as Dorothy, meaning Dorothy sold {jemma_frames_sold}/2 = {dorothy_frames_sold} frames.

If Dorothy sold her glasses frames at half the price that Jemma sold hers, then it means she sold her glasses frames at ${jemma_price_per_frame}/2 = $<<{jemma_price_per_frame}/2={dorothy_price_per_frame}>>{dorothy_price_per_frame} per glasses frame.
In total, Dorothy made ${dorothy_price_per_frame}*{dorothy_frames_sold} = $<<{dorothy_price_per_frame}*{dorothy_frames_sold}={dorothy_total}>>{dorothy_total} from the sale of her glasses frames.
Together, they made ${jemma_total}+${dorothy_total} = $<<{jemma_total}+{dorothy_total}={total_made}>>{total_made} from the sale of the glasses frames.
